A block containing the animations you want to perform. These animations run in the same context as the transition animations and therefore have the same default attributes. You may specify
for this parameter.
The block has no return value and takes the following parameter:
The contextual information for performing the animations. Use this object to get the animation-related information. For more information, see

Use this method to perform animations that arenâ€™t handled by the animator objects themselves. The animations you specify in the
parameter must all take place in a view descended from the view you specify in the
parameter.
The animations in the
parameter are normally performed concurrently with the view controller transition animations. That behavior applies when the animator objectâ€™s
method is implemented using
-based animations. If the animator object uses Core Animation to animate the layer contents directly, your animations are run shortly after the animateTransition: method returns.
This method returns
when the block in the
parameter canâ€™t be queued to run. The completion block can still run even when this method returns

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
An object that manages the content for a rectangular area on the screen.
Tells your animator object to perform the transition animations.
A set of methods that provides support for animations associated with a view controller transition.
Runs the specified animations at the same time as the view controller transition animations.
Runs the specified animations in a view thatâ€™s outside of the designated container view.
Registers a block to be executed when a transition changes from interactive to non-interactive.
Registers a block to be executed when a transition changes from interactive to non-interactive.
A set of methods that provides information about an in-progress view controller transition.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
The return type of functions that donâ€™t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
